Text: O-Owweee! Wh-Why're you so strong today, Lady Alpha?!
Heh... Quite impressive, this magic gear!

This is the true value of magic gear—it makes a
powerful individual even stronger!
Got...better data...than expected.
The experiment was...a success!
Um, Lady Alpha...
Eta's always had this side to her.

She cares little for the lives of others when it
comes to achieving her goals. She may even
lack the capacity to feel such empathy.

But perhaps her honest nature is what makes Eta...
Eta.

You must have felt it while working with her on this
project.
...Yes, indeed.

It's her honest...too honest nature that makes others
want to support her. I mean, look at Epsilon. She's
constantly overindulging the girl.
Lady Alpha...

The others in the Seven Shadows feel the same way
about you.
Do you think so? That would be nice.
I'm sick and tired of your experiments, Eta!

...Built a defense...and training facility...at the
base. Got Gamma and Delta to...help...me
with my experiments.
Yeah? Well done.

(When Eta says she got them to help, I'm sure she
means she dragged them into it.)

(Delta probably just got duped into doing it, but I'm
a little surprised Gamma went along with Eta's
experiments.)

(I wonder if something happened, especially since
Beta—her usual guinea pig—wasn't around.)
Still lots of room for improvement...

Any other interesting ideas...besides using a
"knockout system"?
Ideas, huh?

(The knockout system was something I came up with on
the fly. Think I just told her about common plot points in
battle manga...)

(In reality, what usually happens is you end up
leaving someone behind while the others move
on, accidentally warp ahead a few steps, or are
run in circles if you don't get the order right.)
Let's see... How about "riddles"?
Riddles...?
Yeah, riddles. They're like quizzes.

So you'll need to use your head, not just your
strength, to unlock the passage and advance.

Oh...that's super interesting! But then...Delta
wouldn't be able to advance.

Well...yeah... Maybe you could give her the answers
from the start.

(Although there's no guarantee Delta will even
remember the answers!)
So for example, what kind of riddle?

What do Midgar tuna and experimental materials have
in common? Ask your heart. The answer...will illuminate
your path forward!
Tuna...?

(That reminds me of the tuna meuniere I had for lunch
today.)

(Come to think of it, when's the last time I ate some
sashimi? Here they think you're insane for eating
raw fish. What're some less conspicuous ways to
make and eat fish, Japanese-style?)
I'll need some time to think of the answer...

Yup...always interesting to hear what Master has to
say.
